Convolution2D¶

class layers.Convolution2D.Convolution2D(num_filters, kernel_size, input_channels, stride=1, padding=0)[source]¶

Implements a 2D Convolutional layer.

This layer creates a convolution kernel that is convolved with the layer input to produce a tensor of outputs (feature maps). It is the core building block for Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs).

kernels¶

The weights (filters) of the layer.

Type:

np.ndarray

biases¶

The bias vector of the layer.

Type:

np.ndarray

params¶

A list containing the trainable parameters [kernels, biases].

Type:

list

stride¶

The stride of the convolution.

Type:

tuple

padding¶

The amount of zero-padding added to the input.

Type:

int

backward(output_gradient)[source]¶

Performs the backward pass (backpropagation) for the convolution.

Parameters:

output_gradient (np.ndarray) – Gradient of the loss with respect to the output of this layer.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • The gradient with respect to the layer’s input.

  • A list with the gradients for the kernels and biases.

Return type:

tuple[np.ndarray, list]

forward(input_data)[source]¶

Performs the forward pass of the convolution.

Parameters:

input_data (np.ndarray) – Input data with shape (N, H_in, W_in, C_in).

Returns:

Output feature map with shape (N, H_out, W_out, F).

Return type:

np.ndarray
